title: How to Make a Raining Rainbow Canvas Art

steps.headline: Gather the colors of crayons that you would like to use.
steps.description: Note that if you're doing a realistic rainbow, you will need shades of red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple, depending on your taste. If you're doing a rainbow that's differently colored, that's fine too. You could use pastels, psychedelic colors, your favorite colors, etc. It's art, so use your creativity.

steps.headline: Cover the area in which you'll be working.
steps.description: This is to prevent any staining from the wax colors.

steps.headline: Hot glue the crayons to the canvas.
steps.description: Glue them in a rainbow formation.

steps.headline: Place the blow dryer on the high heat setting.
Hold the hot blow dryer air flow over the crayons.
steps.description: Allow the crayons to begin melting and dripping down the canvas. Do this slowly, in small increments. Take care to keep your skin well away from both the heat source and the melting wax, as you could burn your skin if it comes into contact with either.

steps.headline: Continue until you're happy with the end result.
Let it dry overnight.
steps.description: The next day, when dry, it will be ready to hang on your wall.

steps.headline: Choose the colors of paints that you would like to use.
steps.description: If you're painting a realistic rainbow, you will need shades of red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and purple, depending on your taste. If you're creating a rainbow that's differently colored, choose the appropriate paint colors. You could use pastels, psychedelic colors, your favorite colors, etc. It's art, so use your creativity. Use poster or acrylic paints. Oils and watercolors won't work very well with this project. Cheap, runny paints are a good option.

steps.headline: Set up the workspace.
steps.description: Cover the area you'll be working on with paper to protect it. Squeeze out the paints into separate pots in readiness for painting. Have the paintbrushes ready to go.

steps.headline: Paint the rainbow on the canvas.
steps.description: Work very quickly, as you don't want the paint to dry before blowing it.

steps.headline: Set the hair dryer to low or no heat.
steps.description: You only need airflow, not hear for the paint.

steps.headline: Blow the paint downwards from the rainbow design.
steps.description: Allow the paint to run down the canvas in any direction it wishes to go. You'll need to keep working quickly.

steps.headline: Continue until you're happy with the result.
Let dry overnight or for as long as needed.
steps.description: When dry, the canvas is ready to hang on the wall.
